section.title: Overview
section.p: The SPS supports three containerized network functions (CNFs) â€“ an SM, an ME, and an Integrated SM/ME (IG).
The Service Manager (SM) CNF hosts SM application that is used for API access, provisioning, data access, and access to various interfaces of external systems.
The Managed Element (ME) CNF hosts Charging application.

The IG CNF groups all the functionality of SM and ME within a single CNF. The IG solution delivers the smallest overall footprint since both ME and SM functions are able to share the same set of common containers

section.title: Service Manager CNF
section.p: A centralized Service Manager CNF (SM) manages all the SPS Managed Elements in the network. SM is a highly scalable front-end access to the network of SPS sites. It hosts all GUI, provisioning, and external API access. SM runs in an active-active deployment with data replication between the SMs. SM provisions and is aware of the location of all subscriber or device records. SM contains the subscriber location data, but not the actual records themselves.
Configuration management of SPS must go through SM. Direct interaction with SPS Managed Elements for configuration management is not available.

note.p: While SM provides active/active operation with data replication between the two SMs, Nokia recommends that back-to-back transactions for the same subscriber/device or set of devices within a given group, are all sent to the same SM to avoid race conditions with the data replication.

section.p: SM is also composed of a multi-tier architecture, with a front-end tier of API or GUI, an application tier, and a persistent store database. The OAM functions of the SM are hosted by the OAME containers.

section.title: Managed Element CNF
section.p: Managed Elements (ME) provide the charging function in SPS. MEs include the charging application and include the database for managing all subscriber and device records, including the dynamic data updated as a result of charging transactions. MEs produce charging data records (CDRs) to record the details of all transactions.

section.title: Integrated SM/ME CNF
section.p: One way to reduce overall SPS footprint in an operator network is to deploy an integrated SM / ME, rather than separate and independent SM and ME. The SM and ME provide very different network functions, however, the underlying infrastructure for those two functions share a common foundation. By deploying both SM and ME together on a single platform infrastructure, the overall footprint is reduced.
